definition: to neglect/to skip (class or work)/to waste (time)/vast/loose-fitting

sentences.english: Then David rose and went down to the wilderness of Paran.
sentences.chinese: 大卫起身，下到巴兰的旷野。

sentences.english: Antarctica is one of the last real wildernesses left on the earth.
sentences.chinese: 南极洲是地球上所剩不多的旷野之一。

sentences.english: I gaze on the moon as I tread the drear wild.
sentences.chinese: 行在阴霾的旷野我凝视着天上的月。

sentences.english: Better to live in a desert than with a quarrelsome and ill-tempered wife.
sentences.chinese: 宁可住在旷野，不与争吵使气的妇人同住。

sentences.english: On the east, your southern boundary will start from the end of the Salt Sea
sentences.chinese: 南角要从寻的旷野，贴着以东的边界。

sentences.english: He turned the desert into pools of water and the parched ground into flowing springs;
sentences.chinese: 他使旷野变为水潭，叫旱地变为水泉。

sentences.english: And David heard in the wilderness that Nabal did shear his sheep.
sentences.chinese: 大卫在旷野听见说拿八剪羊毛。

sentences.english: The Lord said to him, 'Go back the way you came, and go to the Desert of Damascus. When you get there, anoint Hazael king over Aram.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华对他说，你回去，从旷野往大马色去。

sentences.english: And they took their journey from Succoth， and encamped in Etham， in the edge of the wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 他们从疏割起行，在旷野边的以倘安营。

sentences.english: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
sentences.chinese: 在旷野有人声喊着说，豫备主的道，修直他的路。

sentences.english: The bleak moorland stretched on all sides as far as the eye could see.
sentences.chinese: 荒凉的旷野向四面伸展开去，一望无际。

sentences.english: Flee, save your lives, and be like the heath in the wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 你们要奔逃，自救性命，独自居住，好像旷野的杜松。

sentences.english: They left the Red Sea and camped in the Desert of Sin.
sentences.chinese: 从红海边起行，安营在汛的旷野。

sentences.english: Jesus was tempted during His 40-day fast in the wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣在旷野里禁食40天，所受诱惑颇多。

sentences.english: I have given the waste land for a heritage, and the salt land as a living-place.
sentences.chinese: 我使旷野作它的住处，使咸地当它的居所。

sentences.english: They left Rephidim and camped in the Desert of Sinai.
sentences.chinese: 从利非订起行，安营在西奈的旷野。

definition: left to return to unchecked growth/overgrown/grown wild
